chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A1: Type
B1: Type
A2: Type
B2: Type
R1: injection A1 B1
R2: injection A2 B2

Goal:
injection (A1 + A2) (B1 + B2)

Premises:
Record injection (A B : Type) : Type := Build_injection { inj_R : A -> B -> Prop; im_inj : image_defined inj_R; pf_inj : partial_functional inj_R; in_inj : injective inj_R } For injection: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For Build_injection: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope _ _ _]
pf_inj : forall (A B : Type) (i : injection A B), partial_functional i
im_inj : forall (A B : Type) (i : injection A B), image_defined i
in_inj : forall (A B : Type) (i : injection A B), injective i
inj_R : forall A B : Type, injection A B -> A -> B -> Prop
FBuild_injection : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B), function_injective f -> injection A B
Build_injection : forall (A B : Type) (inj_R : A -> B -> Prop), image_defined inj_R -> partial_functional inj_R -> injective inj_R -> injection A B
injection_trans = fun (A B C : Type) (R1 : injection A B) (R2 : injection B C) => {| inj_R := fun (a : A) (c : C) => exists b : B, R1 a b /\ R2 b c; im_inj := fun a : A => let e : exists b : B, R1 a b := im_inj A B R1 a in match e with | ex_intro _ b H => let e0 : exists b0 : C, R2 b b0 := im_inj B C R2 b in match e0 with | ex_intro _ c H0 => ex_intro (fun b0 : C => exists b1 : B, R1 a b1 /\ R2 b1 b0) c (ex_intro (fun b0 : B => R1 a b0 /\ R2 b0 c) b (conj H H0)) end end; pf_inj := fun (a : A) (c1 c2 : C) (H : exists b...
Z.add_succ_l : forall n m : Z, (Z.succ n + m)%Z = Z.succ (n + m)
Z.add_lt_mono_l : forall n m p : Z, (n < m)%Z < -> (p + n < p + m)%Z
Z_modulo_2 : forall n : Z, {y : Z | n = (2 * y)%Z} + {y : Z | n = (2 * y + 1)%Z}
Z.add_0_l : forall n : Z, (0 + n)%Z = n
Zeven_odd_dec : forall n : Z, {Zeven n} + {Zodd n}
sum_rect : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> Type), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
sumbool_rec : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Set), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
sum_rec : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> Set), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
sum_sind : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> SProp), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
sum_ind : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
Z.add_1_l : forall n : Z, (1 + n)%Z = Z.succ n
Sumbool.sumbool_of_bool : forall b : bool, {b = true} + {b = false}
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.cardinal = fix cardinal (m : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) : nat := match m with | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Leaf => 0 | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node l true r => S (cardinal l + cardinal r) | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node l false r => cardinal l + cardinal r end : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t -> nat
Z.mul_succ_r : forall n m : Z, (n * Z.succ m)%Z = (n * m + n)%Z
Zodd_div2 : forall n : Z, Zodd n -> n = (2 * Z.div2 n + 1)%Z
BinIntDef.Z.succ = fun x : Z => (x + 1)%Z : Z -> Z Argument scope is [Z_scope]
BinIntDef.Z.pred = fun x : Z => (x + -1)%Z : Z -> Z Argument scope is [Z_scope]
ssrbool.is_inl = fun (A B : Type) (u : A + B) => match u with | inl _ => true | inr _ => false end : forall A B : Type, A + B -> bool Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
le_AsB_sind : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (P : A + B -> A + B -> SProp), (forall x y : A, leA x y -> P (inl x) (inl y)) -> (forall (x : A) (y : B), P (inl x) (inr y)) -> (forall x y : B, leB x y -> P (inr x) (inr y)) -> forall s s0 : A + B, le_AsB A B leA leB s s0 -> P s s0
le_AsB_ind : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (P : A + B -> A + B -> Prop), (forall x y : A, leA x y -> P (inl x) (inl y)) -> (forall (x : A) (y : B), P (inl x) (inr y)) -> (forall x y : B, leB x y -> P (inr x) (inr y)) -> forall s s0 : A + B, le_AsB A B leA leB s s0 -> P s s0
Z.div_mod : forall a b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> a = (b * (a / b) + a mod b)%Z
Ndec.Ndouble_or_double_plus_un : forall a : N, {a0 : N | a = N.double a0} + {a1 : N | a = N.succ_double a1}
ssrbool.classic_pick : forall (T : Type) (P : T -> Prop), ssrbool.classically ({x : T | P x} + (forall x : T, ~ P x))
